abstract.text: Apply textures to the surface of your scene’s 3D objects to give each object a unique appearance.

inlineContent.text: Materials define the appearance of 3D models in RealityKit, by defining how their surfaces interact with light. Materials can also occlude objects behind them, hold shaders, or act as portals to view other worlds with
RealityKit includes a few material types to help you get started, including
for basic color and textures, and
for realistic lighting effects such as reflections, roughness, and emission.

abstract.text: An object that defines an entity’s reflectiveness.
An object that stores fine surface details for an entity in an image
texture.
The abstract superclass for objects representing compute functions for RealityKit custom materials .
An alias for the texture coordinate transform that’s appropriate for this material class.
A type that describes the material aspects of a mesh, like color and
texture.
An alias for the color type that’s appropriate for the current platform.
A component that allows entities to cross portal boundaries.
The type used to represent opacity information.
A basic material that responds to lights in the scene.
Create personalized and realistic spatial audio experiences.
An enumeration for specifying how to allocate and generate mipmaps for a texture.
Present videos in your RealityKit experiences.
